choices.D: A local policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Central, and a global policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Manager.
choices.A: A local policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Central, and a global policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Director.
choices.C: A local policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Director, and a global policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Central.
choices.B: A local policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Manager, and a global policy is applied by using Cisco UCS Central.

questions.question_text: You use Cisco UCS Central to manage Cisco UCS. Which statement accurately describes how local and global policies are applied?

discussion.content:
Correct answer: CDEFG
Cisco IMC is a baseboard management controller that provides embedded server management for Cisco UCS C-Series Rack Servers and Cisco S-Series Storage Servers.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/servers-unified-computing/ucs-b-series-blade-servers/data_sheet_c78-728802.html
Why UCS Manager instead of the IMC?

questions.question_text: Which five options are Cisco UCS hardware components? (Choose five.)

discussion.content:
Correct answer: BCF
SPAN destination type in not supported, but supported FCoE uplink.

When you set the port mode to Fibre Channel, you can configure the following port types:
Fibre Channel uplink ports
Fibre Channel port channel members
Fibre Channel storage ports
FCoE Uplink ports
SPAN source ports

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Storage-Mgmt/3-1/b_UCSM_GUI_Storage_Management_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_GUI_Storage_Management_Guide_3_1_chapter_01100.html#concept_E62AB74B45CB4446839220741434B1DD
